trans-unit.source: Manage assets
trans-unit.target: Manage assets

trans-unit.source: Beginner
trans-unit.target: Beginner

trans-unit.source: This page explains how to edit and manage your assets.
trans-unit.target: This page explains how to edit and manage your assets.

trans-unit.source: Edit assets in the Property Grid
trans-unit.target: Edit assets in the Property Grid

trans-unit.source: You can edit most assets using the Property Grid. By default, this is in the top-right of Game Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can edit most assets using the Property Grid. By default, this is in the top-right of Game Studio.

trans-unit.source: For example, to change the color of a material asset::
trans-unit.target: For example, to change the color of a material asset::

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View (in the bottom by default), select the material.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View (in the bottom by default), select the material.

trans-unit.source: Select material in the Asset View
trans-unit.target: Select material in the Asset View

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, under Shading > Diffuse, next to Diffuse Map, click the colored box, which displays the asset color (yellow in this example).
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, under Shading > Diffuse, next to Diffuse Map, click the colored box, which displays the asset color (yellow in this example).

trans-unit.source: The color picker opens.
trans-unit.target: The color picker opens.

trans-unit.source: Color picker and Palette
trans-unit.target: Color picker and Palette

trans-unit.source: Select a new color for the asset.
trans-unit.target: Select a new color for the asset.

trans-unit.source: Asset is now red
trans-unit.target: Asset is now red

trans-unit.source: The Asset Preview (bottom right by default) displays asset changes in real time.
trans-unit.target: The Asset Preview (bottom right by default) displays asset changes in real time.

trans-unit.source: The Asset View indicates assets with unsaved changes with asterisks (*).
trans-unit.target: The Asset View indicates assets with unsaved changes with asterisks (*).

trans-unit.source: Unsaved changes
trans-unit.target: Unsaved changes

trans-unit.source: Edit assets using dedicated editors
trans-unit.target: Edit assets using dedicated editors

trans-unit.source: Game Studio has dedicated editors for the following asset types:
trans-unit.target: Game Studio has dedicated editors for the following asset types:

trans-unit.source: prefabs
trans-unit.target: prefabs

trans-unit.source: scenes
trans-unit.target: scenes

trans-unit.source: sprite sheets
trans-unit.target: sprite sheets

trans-unit.source: UI pages
trans-unit.target: UI pages

trans-unit.source: UI libraries
trans-unit.target: UI libraries

trans-unit.source: scripts
trans-unit.target: scripts

trans-unit.source: For example, you edit scenes in the Scene Editor.
trans-unit.target: For example, you edit scenes in the Scene Editor.

trans-unit.source: Scene Editor
trans-unit.target: Scene Editor

trans-unit.source: To open the dedicated editor for these types of asset:
trans-unit.target: To open the dedicated editor for these types of asset:

trans-unit.source: double-click the asset, or
trans-unit.target: double-click the asset, or

trans-unit.source: right-click the asset and select Edit asset, or
trans-unit.target: right-click the asset and select Edit asset, or

trans-unit.source: select the asset and type Ctrl + Enter
trans-unit.target: select the asset and type Ctrl + Enter

trans-unit.source: Organize assets
trans-unit.target: Organize assets

trans-unit.source: We recommend you organize your assets into subfolders by type. This makes projects much easier to manage, especially as they become large.
trans-unit.target: We recommend you organize your assets into subfolders by type. This makes projects much easier to manage, especially as they become large.

trans-unit.source: Organized project
trans-unit.target: Organized project

trans-unit.source: Assets are contained in the Assets folder of your project package. You can see the project in the Solution Explorer (by default shown in the bottom left).
trans-unit.target: Assets are contained in the Assets folder of your project package. You can see the project in the Solution Explorer (by default shown in the bottom left).

trans-unit.source: To create a subfolder, right-click the parent folder and select Create subfolder.
trans-unit.target: To create a subfolder, right-click the parent folder and select Create subfolder.

trans-unit.source: To move an asset, select one or more assets in the Asset View and drag and drop them to the folder.
trans-unit.target: To move an asset, select one or more assets in the Asset View and drag and drop them to the folder.

trans-unit.source: !NOTE When you move an asset, Game Studio updates all references to other assets inside the asset.
trans-unit.target: !NOTE When you move an asset, Game Studio updates all references to other assets inside the asset.

trans-unit.source: !TIP To see the URL and type of an asset, move the mouse over the asset thumbnail. Details of new asset in Asset View tab
trans-unit.target: !TIP To see the URL and type of an asset, move the mouse over the asset thumbnail. Details of new asset in Asset View tab

trans-unit.source: Include assets in the build
trans-unit.target: Include assets in the build

trans-unit.source: By default, Stride doesn't include every asset when you build the game. This is because you might not need every asset at runtime — for example, if the asset is incomplete.
trans-unit.target: By default, Stride doesn't include every asset when you build the game. This is because you might not need every asset at runtime — for example, if the asset is incomplete.

trans-unit.source: Stride only includes assets which:
trans-unit.target: Stride only includes assets which:

trans-unit.source: you've specifically marked for inclusion (root assets), or
trans-unit.target: you've specifically marked for inclusion (root assets), or

trans-unit.source: are referenced by a root asset
trans-unit.target: are referenced by a root asset

trans-unit.source: Game Studio indicates whether an asset is included with a colored icon in the top-left of the asset thumbnail.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio indicates whether an asset is included with a colored icon in the top-left of the asset thumbnail.

trans-unit.source: Color
trans-unit.target: Color

trans-unit.source: Status
trans-unit.target: Status

trans-unit.source: Blue
trans-unit.target: Blue

trans-unit.source: Blue
trans-unit.target: Blue

trans-unit.source: The asset is a root asset and included in the build.
trans-unit.target: The asset is a root asset and included in the build.

trans-unit.source: Green
trans-unit.target: Green

trans-unit.source: Green
trans-unit.target: Green

trans-unit.source: The asset is referenced by a root asset and included in the build.
trans-unit.target: The asset is referenced by a root asset and included in the build.

trans-unit.source: Gray
trans-unit.target: Gray

trans-unit.source: Gray
trans-unit.target: Gray

trans-unit.source: The asset isn't included in the build.
trans-unit.target: The asset isn't included in the build.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to load an asset at runtime using scripts, make it a root asset. To do this:
trans-unit.target: If you plan to load an asset at runtime using scripts, make it a root asset. To do this:

trans-unit.source: click the gray dot in the top-left of the thumbnail, or
trans-unit.target: click the gray dot in the top-left of the thumbnail, or

trans-unit.source: right-click the asset and select Include in build as root asset
trans-unit.target: right-click the asset and select Include in build as root asset

trans-unit.source: Include in build as root asset
trans-unit.target: Include in build as root asset

trans-unit.source: Asset View options
trans-unit.target: Asset View options

trans-unit.source: To change the Asset View options, click the eye icon in the Asset View toolbar.
trans-unit.target: To change the Asset View options, click the eye icon in the Asset View toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Asset View options
trans-unit.target: Asset View options

trans-unit.source: You can:
trans-unit.target: You can:

trans-unit.source: display assets in the selected folder only, the selected folder and subfolder
trans-unit.target: display assets in the selected folder only, the selected folder and subfolder

trans-unit.source: sort assets by name, type, unsaved changes, and modification date
trans-unit.target: sort assets by name, type, unsaved changes, and modification date

trans-unit.source: switch between tile view (default) and grid view
trans-unit.target: switch between tile view (default) and grid view

trans-unit.source: Filter assets
trans-unit.target: Filter assets

trans-unit.source: When browsing assets in the Asset View (in the bottom by default), you can filter by name, tag, type, or a combination of all three.
trans-unit.target: When browsing assets in the Asset View (in the bottom by default), you can filter by name, tag, type, or a combination of all three.

trans-unit.source: The tag and name filters are "and" filters. For example, if you filter by tag:level and name:knight, the Asset View only displays assets with the tag "level" and the name "knight".
trans-unit.target: The tag and name filters are "and" filters. For example, if you filter by tag:level and name:knight, the Asset View only displays assets with the tag "level" and the name "knight".

trans-unit.source: Type filters are "or" filters. For example, if you filter by type:animation and type:texture, the Asset View only displays assets that are animations or textures.
trans-unit.target: Type filters are "or" filters. For example, if you filter by type:animation and type:texture, the Asset View only displays assets that are animations or textures.

trans-unit.source: Add a filter
trans-unit.target: Add a filter

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, type in the filter bar.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, type in the filter bar.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio displays a list of matching filters (name, type, or tag).
trans-unit.target: Game Studio displays a list of matching filters (name, type, or tag).

trans-unit.source: add-filter.png
trans-unit.target: add-filter.png

trans-unit.source: To filter by name, press Enter.
trans-unit.target: To filter by name, press Enter.

trans-unit.source: To filter by a tag or type, select tag or type filters in the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: To filter by a tag or type, select tag or type filters in the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio applies the filter and shows matching assets in the Asset View.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio applies the filter and shows matching assets in the Asset View.

trans-unit.source: You can add multiple filters. Name filters are green, tag filters are blue, and type filters are orange.
trans-unit.target: You can add multiple filters. Name filters are green, tag filters are blue, and type filters are orange.

trans-unit.source: filter-tags
trans-unit.target: filter-tags

trans-unit.source: Toggle filters on and off
trans-unit.target: Toggle filters on and off

trans-unit.source: To toggle a filter on and off without removing it, click it. Disabled filters have darker colors.
trans-unit.target: To toggle a filter on and off without removing it, click it. Disabled filters have darker colors.

trans-unit.source: filter-tags
trans-unit.target: filter-tags

trans-unit.source: Remove a filter
trans-unit.target: Remove a filter

trans-unit.source: To remove a filter, click the X icon in the filter tag.
trans-unit.target: To remove a filter, click the X icon in the filter tag.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
